column.name: TITLE

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Transmission of Information questionnaire

column.name: REPORT_FREQ_DETAIL
column.value: 31 December

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: Questionnaire "Transmission of Information" (in accordance with Articles 13 & 16 of the Basel Convention). MS Word text document and MS Excel document (altogether 9 tables). Manual for the Implementation of the Basel Convention, 10. Transmission of information

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: The Convention's secretariat provides the parties to the Convention with prefilled questionnaires. The main request for reporting concerns the amount of different generated wastes and the export and import of them to and from other countries. EU Member States have obligation to send a copy of this report to the European Commission (DG Environment) according to Article 51(1) of Regulation (EC) No 1013/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 June 2006 on shipments of waste.

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Marine Strategy Framework Directive reporting resources

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value:
This reporting obligation has been created for technical reasons. It identifies the deliveries of national spatial data sets under the MSFD reporting on Article 4 (geographic areas).
Member States shall, when implementing their obligations under this Directive, take due account of the fact that their marine waters form an integral part of the marine regions and subregions, and they shall inform the Commission of any subdivisions of those.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Water Framework Directive - Programmes of Measures - 2012 Reporting

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: WFD 2012 reporting resources

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value:
WFD reporting resources at ETC/ICM web site contains all needed support files for reporting including help documents and schemas.
The programmes of measures shall be established at the latest 9 years, measures operational at the latest 12 years, and the programmes reviewed, and if necessary updated at the latest 15 years after the date of entry into force of WFD and every six years thereafter.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: review 22/12/2018. Member States shall, within three years of the publication of each WFD River Basin Management Plan or its update, submit an interim report describing progress in the implementation of the planned programme of measures.

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: 1995-3, Submission of data for the Annual Report on Discharges etc. from offshore installations

column.name: REPORT_FREQ_DETAIL
column.value: 1 November

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: Questionnare available at the Ospar secretariat home page, consisting of one MS Excel file and one MS Word file under the title 'Report on Discharges, Spills and Emissions from Offshore Oil and Gas Installations' at the website.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: In addition to the parameters above also to be reported are the number of installations with discharges to water or emissions to the air and number of installations without discharges or emissions - and total number of installations. Further volumes of water discharged, flaring operation spills and smaller spillages of oil, production and number of installations exceeding the 40 mg/l target standard, number of wells drilled with oiled based muds.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Rhine River Monitoring

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: The Convention website provides the main documents produced under the Convention. A network of 12 stations with sampling and analysis is in place: continuously for basic parameters such as flow, temperature, oxygen concentration and oxygen saturation, pH and conductivity, bi-monthly or monthly for most other parameters.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: The data are available at http://had.bafg.de:8080/iksr-zt/ An international programme for routine transboundary monitoring with regular reporting to the coordinating body is in place (tables in annual reports). See for more information http://www.iwac-riza.org/downloads/10_rivers_report.pdf, chapter 3.3 Art. 3 and 8 of the Convention do not clearly define reporting obligations.

column.name: NEXT_REPORTING
column.value: According to international monitoring programme.

column.value: ETC Water BFB

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: River Convention Reporting Obligation

column.name: PARAMETERS
column.value: In water a number of anions, among which nutrients, sum-parameters (BOD, COD and AOX), metals of the black list, polar pesticides and a number of chlorinated hydrocarbons. In suspended solids, heavy metals, total phosphorus, TOC, classical halogenated pesticides (DDT etc.), 7 PCBs and 6 PAHs.

column.value: Under the new HELCOM reporting strategy there will be more focus on establishing links between driving forces, pressures, state and impacts in the Baltic environment. The intension is to collate all relevant data reported by contracting parties under current European legislative drivers and to request additional data only where it is deemed to be necessary. This will reduce the burden on Contracting Parties and imprive efficiency of overall assessment process.

column.value: At intervals of three years Member States shall send a sectoral report on the implementation of this Directive, covering also other pertinent Community Directives and based on the specific questionnaire to the Commission. The questionnaire or outline shall be sent to the Member States six months before the start of the period covered by the report.

NO3 in groundwater NO3 in surface water

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: The Convention covers all the technical aspects of pollution from ships, except the disposal of waste into the sea by dumping, and applies to ships of all types, although it does not apply to pollution arising out of the exploration and exploitation of sea-bed mineral resources. The Convention has two Protocols dealing respectively with Reports on Incidents involving Harmful Substances and Arbitration; and five Annexes which contain regulations for the prevention of various forms of pollution.

column.value: 1st report shall cover the years 2002, 2003, 2004; the 2nd - 2005, 2006, 2007; etc. The report shall be published within one calendar year of the end of the reporting period and sent to the Commission within two months of the publication.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value:
Directive 98/83/EC has repealed Directive 80/778/EC with effect from five years after the entry into force (i.e. on 25.12.2003).
Transition periods for implementation of the Directive were agreed with Estonia (2013), Latvia (2015), Malta (2005) and Romania (2015).

Specific guidelines are provided for each thematic report.
Parties are requested to submit an original signed copy by post and an electronic copy on diskette or by electronic mail.
An electronic version of each report submitted is sent to all national focal points and is also available on the CBD website.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Triennial National Report

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Quick guide for the AEWA Online Reporting System

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: In 2011, a new online reporting system was launched, replacing the previously used paper-based format for National Reports. The new format, approved by MOP4 in 2008, has substantially facilitated the collection, analysis and use of the information contained in Parties' National Reports. Access to the online reporting system is password protected and granted to designated national respondents only.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Approximately every three years. Next before the 3rd Meeting of the Parties (to be held end of 2005 or early 2006) Resolution 1.3 requested that a preliminary national report be submitted by 1 September 2000 for consideration at the Technical Committee.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Ozone depleting substances (ODS) reporting by undertakings (Article 27)

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Reporting procedure and Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) available at the BDR website

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Every year by 31 March on the data for the previous calendar year

column.name: LOCATION_INFO
column.value: Reportnet Business Data Repository

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Article 27 of the ODS Regulation requires producers, importers exporters, feedstock users and process agent users of ODS to report on quantities produced, imported and exported during the preceding year. Furthermore, destruction facilities need to report on the quantities of ODS destroyed. The reporting covers controlled substances (substances listed in Annex I of the Regulation) and new substances (substances listed in Annex II of the Regulation).

column.name: NATIONAL_CONTACT
column.value: National contact points are available at

column.name: COORDINATOR
column.value: Not applicable (reporting by undertakings)

column.name: AUTHORITY
column.value: Article 27

column.value: UNEP data library on production and consumption on Ozone Depletion Substances (ODS) based on reporting by countries.

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Ramsar National Reports

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: The link provides the approved format for the preparation of National Reports to the 11th meeting of the Conference of the Contracting Parties of the Convention (Bucharest, Romania, June 2012). An optional Annex to the National Report Format is available to allow any Contracting Party that wishes to do so to provide additional information separately for any or all of its Ramsar Sites. The format has been designed and prepared to be used as an electronic tool. Explanatory notes are provided.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Approximately regular. Parties should submit reports every three years, at least six months prior to each ordinary meeting of the Conference of the Parties.

column.value: The model data form is appended to Resolution No. 5 (1998). It is derived from and compatible with the Natura 2000 Standard Data Form. Parties are encouraged to provide information for the Standard Data Form in electronic form. Currently, the Model Form is being revised. The Draft Revised Model Form is one of the working documents at T-PVS Bureau Meeting on the 9th September 2011.

column.value: Report preceding Advisory Committee Meeting

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Format of National Implementation Reports as revised at MoP3

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: Resolution 2.7 states that the report should contain information on developments over the previous year, especially where major changes to the status of any species have occurred, new items of publicity have been issued and research has been considered, begun or completed. The same reporting format is used as for the National Implementation Report and Guidelines for the format are found in Resolutions 2.7 (MoP2/1998/Res.7), 3.3 (MoP3/2000/Res.3) and 4.4 (MoP4/2003/Res.4).

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Approximately regular. Reports should be submitted one month in advance of each Advisory Committee meeting. Meetings are annual and usually held in May.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Updates to the reported data by the MS are possible At Any Time.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Member States shall inform the Commission of the major roads which have more than six million vehicle passages a year, major railways which have more than 60000 train passages per year, major airports and the agglomerations with more than 250000 inhabitants within their territories.

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Not yet available.

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: Article 15(1) provides that the data shall be geo-referenced and transmitted to the Commission by means of computer telecommunications and/or electronic technology. It is also provided that the Commission shall, in close co-operation with the Member States, establish the format and particulars needed for such transmission.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Member states will have to submit annual reports (each year no later than 31 December) on the implementation of the monitoring program and their monitoring activity, with (geo-referenced) data gathered under the scheme and a report on them.

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: The Protocol itself is not specific about the format of the reports. However, Resolution 6(2001) [Exchange of Information] was adopted by the twenty-fourth Antarctic Treaty Consultative Meeting (ATCM XXIV) to rationalise the information requirements of the Protocol. Many Parties submit their reports as Information Papers to annual meetings of the Committee for Environmental Protection (CEP), whilst others post the information on their national website.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Approximately regular.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value:
Argentina, as Secretariat to the Antarctic Treaty, hosts a website which collates the information provided by submitting Parties (http://www.ats.aq/).

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Protection of Seals in the Baltic Sea Area (Recommendation 9/1)

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Contracting Parties report their seal monitoring results to ICES directly, no date or reporting format is set by HELCOM.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Under the new HELCOM reporting strategy there will be more focus on establishing links between driving forces, pressures, state and impacts in the Baltic environment. The intension is to collate all relevant data reported by contracting parties under current European legislative drivers and to request additional data only where it is deemed to be necessary. This will reduce the burden on Contracting Parties and imprive efficiency of overall assessment process.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Report on implementation measures to ban all hunting of grey seals, ringed seals and harbour seals in the Baltic area

column.name: PARAMETERS
column.value: No parameters specified.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Protection of the Coastal Strip (Recommendation 15/1)

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Protection of coastal strip

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Generally protected coastal strip should be established outside urban areas and existing settlements, extending at least 100-300m from the mean water line landwards and seawards. Plans involving significant changes to the coastal zone must be accompanied by an a land use plan and appropriate environmental impact assessment

column.name: NEXT_REPORTING
column.value: HELCOM has stopped regularly reporting and will decide next reporting to be related to thematic assessment.

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: Every three years, Member States shall forward to the Commission a report on the implementation of this Directive in their respective territories. For the latest reporting, a questionnaire, asking for qualitative as well as quantitative aspects of the national implementation of the Directive was sent by the Commission to all the Member States and to Norway. The first report of 1998 is available at: http://ec.europa.eu/environment/dansub/3year_rep.pdf

column.value: Questionnaires or outlines are drafted by the Commission and sent to the Member States. The last was sent in 1997. See Article 13 of the Directive 87/217/EEC amended by Article 4(1) of the Council Directive 91/692/EEC with regard to reporting frequency.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: According to the directive reports should be prepared every three year, but the last questionnaire was sent by the Commission in 1997

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Article 5 and 6 concern emissions to water. This report shall be drawn up on the basis of a questionnaire or outline drafted by the Commission in accordance with the procedure laid down in Directive 91/692/EEC. The questionnaire or outline shall be sent to the Member States six months before the start of the period covered by the report. This report is part of the sectoral report referred to in Council Directive 91/692/EEC article 4 (1) and Annex III. The first reporting period was 1994-1996 inclusive.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Urban Waste Water Treatment Directive - Situation Report

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Recommendation on the format of the Article 16 - situation report

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value:
Member States can either upload their reports as word- or pdf- files and/ or provide the link to a web-site, where the Situation report is published.
The document "Terms and Definitions of the UWWT Directive" is available at: http://ec.europa.eu/environment/water/water-urbanwaste/info/pdf/terms.pdf
Further information is available at the DG ENV Circabc library at: https://circabc.europa.eu/w/browse/8f158856-ae93-4b2a-a2a3-edbd37397ca7

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Member States should upload situation reports as they are published every two years

column.name: RM_VERIFIED_BY
column.value: Caroline Whalley & Fernanda Nery

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value:
The principal aim of this situation report is to inform the public regularly of the situation, on a given date, regarding waste water collection and treatment, as well as to present the development of the situation in relation to at least the two previous years. They have to be transmitted to the Commission as soon as published by the Member States.
Every two years relevant authorities or bodies shall publish situation reports on the disposal of urban waste water and sludge in their areas.

Update of annual questionnaire to include reporting requirements under Directive 2008/50/EC
Questionnaire under Decision 2004/461/EC has been updated to enable reporting on PM2.5 under the requirements of Directive 2008/50/EC, Articles 15 and 16. Reporting on PM2.5 has become mandatory as of reporting year 2010 with 30 September 2011 as deadline for submission.
Member States are strongly encouraged to use this updated version of the Questionnaire, that consists of three new datasheets 8g, 11m and 28.

Superseeds Recommendation 16/8
Reporting should be based on the reporting requirements developed by the Land-based Pollution Group.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Under the new HELCOM reporting strategy there will be more focus on establishing links between driving forces, pressures, state and impacts in the Baltic environment. The intension is to collate all relevant data reported by contracting parties under current European legislative drivers and to request additional data only where it is deemed to be necessary. This will reduce the burden on Contracting Parties and improve efficiency of overall assessment process.

column.name: DESCRIPTION

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: The Contracting Parties shall cooperate: (a) to implement international regulations to prevent, reduce and control pollution of the marine environment from ships; and (b) to take all necessary measures in cases of pollution incidents.

column.name: PARAMETERS
column.value: No.of pollution incidents/spillages at sea

column.value: Article 26 of Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment and Coastal Region of the Mediterranean

column.name: TITLE
column.value: National Report on the technical implementation of the Land-based Sources Protocol

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: New reporting format for the implementation of the Barcelona Convention and its Protocols

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: The Contracting Parties to this Protocol shall take all appropriate measures to prevent, abate, combat and eliminate to the fullest possible extent pollution of the Mediterranean Sea Area caused by discharges from rivers, coastal establishments or outfalls, or emanating from any other land-based sources and activities within their territories, giving priority to the phasing out of inputs of substances that are toxic, persistent and liable to bioaccumulate.

column.name: PARAMETERS
column.value: Statistical information on authorisations of discharges granted; No and type of sanctions applied for non-compliance; Total loads of substances released from all sectors of activitities

column.name: AUTHORITY
column.value: Article 26 of Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment and Coastal Region of the Mediterranean

column.name: TITLE
column.value: National Report on the technical implementation of the SPA & Biodiversity Protocol

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: New reporting format for the implementation of the Barcelona Convention and its Protocols

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: Specially Protected Areas Regional Activity Centre (SPA/RAC) has developed Guidelines for the establishment and management of Mediterranean marine and coastal protected areas and Standard data form (SDF) for the national inventories of natural sites of interest for the conservation. These guidelines together with other publications on protected areas, habitat types and species can be found at http://www.rac-spa.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=116&Itemid=166&lang=en

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Under Article 13, the Parties shall submit to ordinary meetings of the Parties a report on the implementation of this Protocol, in particular on: (a) the status and the state of the areas included in the SPAMI List; (b) any changes in the delimitation or legal status of the SPAMIs and protected species; (c) possible exemptions allowed pursuant to Articles 12 and 18 of this Protocol.

column.name: PARAMETERS
column.value: List of SPAs, proposals made for inclusion under SPAMI list, New records of non-indigenous or genetically modified species

column.name: AUTHORITY
column.value: Article 26 of Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment and Coastal Region of the Mediterranean

column.name: TITLE

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: New reporting format for the implementation of the Barcelona Convention and its Protocols

column.name: COMMENT
column.value:
The Protocol for the Protection of the Mediterranean Sea against Pollution Resulting from Exploration and Exploitation of the Continental Shelf and the Seabed and its Subsoil was adopted on 14 October 1994 by the Conference of Plenipotentiaries held in Madrid and has not yet entered into force.
Additional countries reporting formally: Israel, Lebanon, Syria & the EC.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Contracting Parties shall take, individually or through bilateral or multilateral cooperation, all appropriate measures to prevent, abate, combat and control pollution in the Protocol Area resulting from activities, inter alia by ensuring that the best available techniques, environmentally effective and economically appropriate, are used for this purpose.

column.name: PARAMETERS
column.value: Nature and total quantity of waste involved for each authorisation

column.value: The purpose of this Decision is that by application of the management mechanisms set out in this Decision, authorities shall ensure and actively promote the continued shift towards the use of less hazardous substances (or preferably non-hazardous substances) and, as a result, the reduction of the overall environmental impact resulting from the use and discharge of offshore chemicals.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: The Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic (the “OSPAR Convention”) was opened for signature at the Ministerial Meeting of the former Oslo and Paris Commissions in Paris on 22 September 1992. The Convention entered into force on 25 March 1998. It has been ratified by Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Iceland, Ireland, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Sweden, Switzerland and the United Kingdom and approved by the European Community and Spain.

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Manual for Sampling and Analysis of Litterfall (update June 2004)

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: The Manual refers to the following reporting forms: - Form 14a XX1996.LFP Contents of reduced plot file to be used in combination with the survey on litterfall - Form 14b xx2002.LFM Contents of data file with litterfall analysis information - Form 14c xx2002.LFO Contents of data file with litterfall analysis information

column.name: COMMENT
column.value:
It is recommended that litterfall as a minimum is assessed on 10% of the Level II plots and preferably on those plots where intensive monitoring of meteorology, deposition, soil solution, and phenology are also performed (?key plots?).
EEA maintains a biodiversity information system at http://eunis.eea.eu.int/ that provides information on species, habitats and sites in the context of European legislation.

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Annex: Format for the submission of data and information under Article 12

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value:
Annex to 2007/639/EC Commission Decision sets out a common format for the submission of data and information.
Within two years of the date of entry into force of this regulation, Member States shall draw up and maintain release inventories for the substances listed in Annex III into air, water and land in accordance with their obligations under the Convention and the Protocol.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Wastes from waste management facilities, off-site waste water treatment plants and the preparation of water intended for human consumption and water from industrial use are submitted to this text. Member States shall provide the Commission every year with statistical data on the actual or estimated total production and placing on the market of any substance listed in Annex I or II.

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Reporting format for Recommendation 17/8

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Under the new HELCOM reporting strategy there will be more focus on establishing links between driving forces, pressures, state and impacts in the Baltic environment. The intension is to collate all relevant data reported by contracting parties under current European legislative drivers and to request additional data only where it is deemed to be necessary. This will reduce the burden on Contracting Parties and imprive efficiency of overall assessment process.

column.name: NEXT_REPORTING
column.value: HELCOM has stopped regularly reporting and will decide next reporting to be related to thematic assessment.

column.name: RM_VERIFIED_BY
column.value: Arne Jensen

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Kraft pulp mills are responsible for an important part of the discharges from the pulp and paper industry into the Baltic Sea, and this Recommendation recognises the importance of limiting discharges into the Baltic Sea from production of kraft pulp by application of best available technology as defined in HELCOM Recommendation 12/3.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: OSPAR Recommendation 2005/1 on Reporting Formats on the Implementation and Effectiveness of OSPAR Measures Relating to the Non-Ferrous Metal Industry

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: This reporting format replaces the existing implementations reporting formats in the following OSPAR measures: PARCOM Recommendations 92/1 and 96/1 and OSPAR Recommendations 98/1, 98/2 and 2002/1.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: The report should be submitted for the first time in the meeting cycle 2007/2008 and, if the Commission judges it necessary, every four years thereafter until the specified OSPAR measures are fully implemented.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: This Recommendation aims to simplify and rationalise the existing reporting commitments by replacing the existing implementation reporting formats in the specified OSPAR measures with one single reporting format, aligning the reporting years set out in these measures, and introducing new reporting commitments for lead, cadmium and mercury for the relevant sectors of the non-ferrous metal industry (Art 2)

column.name: PARAMETERS
column.value: Report on measures taken, and effectiveness of implementation and compliance.

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: This Recommendation applies to the primary metallurgical industry producing one or more of the following metals or process related compounds: zinc, copper, lead or nickel.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: The purpose of this Recommendation is to set an environmental goal for the discharge of offshore chemicals that are, or which contain substances identified as candidates for substitution, in order to set a specific time-frame for moving towards the cessation of these discharges from offshore installations. This Recommendation applies to Contracting Parties which have offshore installations under their jurisdiction in their internal waters or territorial sea, or on their continental shelf.

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Guidance for developing a national implementation plan for the Stockholm Convention

column.name: NEXT_REPORTING
column.value: Within two years of ratification

column.name: LOCATION_INFO
column.value: Stockholm Convention Secretariate

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: In accordance with paragraph 1 of Article 7 of the Stockholm Convention, each Party develop and endeavor to implement a plan for the implementation of its obligations under the Convention and to transmit its plan to the Conference of the Parties within two years of the date on which the Convention enters into force for it. Financing for eligible countries to develop these plans is available through the Global Environment Facility.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: The flood hazard maps and flood risk maps shall be completed by 22/12/ 2013 and made available to the Commission three months after. First review, and if necessary update, shall be completed by 22/12/2019 and every 6 years thereafter.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: A Handbook on good practices for flood mapping in Europe including the Atlas of Flood Maps gives an insight in current practices across the EU and support Member States in understanding the requirements for flood mapping as set out in article 6 of the Floods Directive (http://ec.europa.eu/environment/water/flood_risk/flood_atlas/index.htm).

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Floods Directive reporting resources

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value:
The components of the first management plan and its subsequent update are defined in the Annex to the Directive.
The Reporting sheet for the Flood Risk Management Plans is available at Flood Risk Management WFD CIRCA library: https://circabc.europa.eu/w/browse/71b62986-603f-416d-9d9e-e25cdbd1a130

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: The FRMP shall be completed by 22/12/2015 and made available to the Commission three months after. First review, and if necessary update, shall be completed by 22/12/2021 and every 6 years thereafter.

column.name: RM_VERIFIED_BY
column.value: Wouter Vanneuville (EEA)

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Member States shall establish flood risk management plans (FRMP). The FRMP must set out appropriate objectives for the management of flood risk within the areas covered by the plan. The objectives must focus on reducing the adverse consequences of flooding for human health, the environment, cultural heritage and economic activities.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Member States without marine waters shall bring into force only those measures which are necessary to ensure compliance with requirements under Article 6 (Regional cooperation) and Article 7 (Competent authorities).

column.value: MSFD report on Marine Region or Subregion competent authority or authorities

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: MSFD reporting resources

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value:
The main elements are defined in the Annex II to the Directive.
MSFD reporting resources at ETC/W web site contains all needed support files for reporting including help documents and schemas.
See also for the Marine strategy CIRCABC library at https://circabc.europa.eu/w/browse/f088529c-41a7-4b2e-b92a-e8838a6b3396

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Designation of competent authorities by 15/07/2010. Informing the Commission of any changes within six months.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value:
Member States shall, as far as possible, build upon relevant existing programmes and activities developed in the framework of structures stemming from international agreements such as Regional Sea Conventions.
Coordination and cooperation shall be extended, where appropriate, to all Member States in the catchment area of a marine region or subregion, including land-locked countries.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: EC Water Reporting Obligation Member States shall provide the Commission with a list of the competent authorities designated for each marine region or subregion concerned, together with a list of their competent authorities as regards those international bodies in which they participate and which are relevant for the implementation of this Directive. The authority or authorities competent for cooperation and coordination as referred to in Article 6 shall also be designated.

column.name: COORDINATOR

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Year only specified.

column.name: LOCATION_INFO
column.value: Reportnet Central Data Repository

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Member States shall, in respect of each marine region or subregion concerned, identify the measures which need to be taken in order to achieve or maintain good environmental status in their marine waters, including spatial protection measures, contributing to coherent and representative networks of marine protected areas. Within the present obligation, they also have to report on the exceptions where environmental targets or good environmental status cannot be achieved by 2020.

column.name: COORDINATOR

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: All required guidelines are available from the official INSPIRE web page.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: The reporting date of the two sibling obligations (INSPIRE Monitoring and Reporting) is synchronized. Both have to be submitted by 15 May - one on annual cycles, the other every three years.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Monitoring and reporting provide important information on the development of the NSDI (National Spatial Data Infrastructure) and INSPIRE and therefore constitute an important source of information for decisions concerning the implementation of INSPIRE Directive and for the future evolution.

column.name: AUTHORITY
column.value: Article 21

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Results of research conducted under special permit

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: No specific format is provided.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Article VIII(3) requires Contracting Parties that have issued special permits to report at intervals of not more than one year.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value:
This reporting obligation was terminated because it is covered by 'Progress report on cetacean research'
At the 38th Annual Meeting in 1986, the IWC recommended that Contracting Governments submit the results of research obtained from permits not later than 60 days before the next Annual meeting of the Scientific Committee.
EEA maintains a biodiversity information system at http://eunis.eea.eu.int/ that provides information on species, habitats and sites in the context of European legislation.

column.name: NEXT_REPORTING
column.value: As required.

column.name: AUTHORITY
column.value: Article 13

column.name: TITLE
column.value: SoER Part C Commonality Air Pollution: why do we care about this theme?

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Part C Guidance

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: A brief introduction explaining why the topic in question is important for the natural environment and human health/human well-being at national level. Linkages can be made with national priorities and strategies for the given topic.

column.name: DATA_USED_FOR
column.value: State of Europe's Environment

column.name: TITLE
column.value: SoER Part C Commonality Air Pollution: What are the state (S) and impacts (I) related to this theme, including impacts on the natural environment and human health/human well-being, both at national level as well as in transboundary terms?

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Part C Guidance

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Evaluation of the state and trends as well as assessment of the impacts in accordance with the country’s own priority issues within the given topic area. The countries can address the diversity of their individual situation in terms of geography, as well as social, cultural, economic and environmental legacies.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: SoER Part C Commonality Air Pollution: What are the related key drivers (D) and pressures (P) at national level?

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Part C Guidance

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Description of main driving forces (demographic, economic, etc) and pressures on the natural environment and human health/well-being at country level. Again, the countries can address the diversity of their individual situation in terms of geography, as well as social, cultural, economic and environmental legacies.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: SoER Part C Commonality Air Pollution: What is the 2020 outlook for the topic in question and how will this affect possible impacts on the natural environment and human health/well-being?

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Part C Guidance

column.name: NEXT_REPORTING

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Waste Framework Directive implementation report

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Commission Implementing Decision of 18 April 2012 establishing a questionnaire for Member States rep

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: According to Article 37 of the WFD, every three years member States shall inform the commission of the implementation of this Directive by submitting a sectorial report in an electronic format. The implementation report in 2013 shall be based on the Implementation Questionaire (Commission Implementing Decision of 18 April 2012) The reporting period is 12 December 2010 to 31 December 2012 (EC 11 June 2012 Note to TAC Commiittee)

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: The Directive will be in effect from 12/12/2010 and it repeals the Directives 75/439/EEC, 91/689/EEC and 2006/12/EC

Reporting template is valid since 2000. Last amendment was done in 2008, to make it closer to EEA. It is available on web, but for internal use.
Includes list of Hot spots, coordinates of monitoring stations, river/municipal and industrial loads for an agreed list of determinands how to be reported. General information – how to report on implementation of legal/policy documents.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value:
The 5-year BSC reports (State of the Black Sea Environment, Implementation of the Black Sea Strategic Action Plan, Marine Litter Report) are available at http://www.blacksea-commission.org/_publications.asp
BSC prepares also annual report on reported data.
BCS Information System (http://www.blacksea-commission.org/_bsis.asp) Black Sea GIS (http://www.blacksea-commission.org/_bsgis2.asp) BSIMAP (http://www.blacksea-commission.org/_bsimap.asp)
Overlapping with IMO reporting obligations.

column.name: LOCATION_INFO
column.value: The countries send their data and reports via E-mail.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value:
Implementation of the two protocols: -Protocol on Cooperation in combating pollution of the Black Sea Marine Environment by Oil and Other Harmful Substances in Emergency Situations, -Protocol on The Protection of The Black Sea Marine Environment Against Pollution by Dumping.
Safety aspects of shipping including ballast waters transportation, port Reception facilities, dispersants, ships calling at ports, quantities of cargoes, oil spills, dumping, pollution fines.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Member States shall, within three years of the publication of each MSFD programmes of measures or update, submit a brief interim report describing progress in the implementation of that programme.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Member States shall take into account relevant measures required under Community legislation, in particular the Water Framework Directive, the UWWT Directive, the New Bathing Water Directive, as well as forthcoming legislation on environmental quality standards in the field of water policy, or international agreements.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: OSPAR Recommendation 2010/4 on a Harmonised Pre-screening Scheme for Offshore Chemicals

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: When reporting on the implementation of this Recommendation, the implementation format given in Appendix 2 to the Recommendation should be used.

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: Reports should be submitted in accordance with the timing of the implementation reporting on OSPAR Decision 2000/2.

column.name: NEXT_REPORTING
column.value: Reports should be made on a biennial basis

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: This Recommendation replaces OSPAR Recommendation 2000/4 as amended by OSPAR Recommendation 2008/1. The purpose of pre-screening is to allow authorities to identify substances intended to be used, or used in, offshore chemicals with the aim of substituting those substances which are hazardous, and regulating and controlling the other substances, where necessary. This Recommendation will be reviewed and, if necessary, revised in 2014.

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: Directive 2008/98/EC requires Member States to report to the commission , every three years as in accordance with Article 37, on their record with regard to meeting the targets of Article 11 ( 50% preparing for re-use and recycling of household and similar waste: 70 % preparing for reuse and recycling of contruction and demolition waste) by 2020. If the targets are not met, this report shall include the reasons for failure and the actions the Member State intends to take to meet those targets.

column.name: DESCRIPTION

column.value: Information concerning the operation of the procedures

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2016/770 of 14 April 2016 establishing a common format for the

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: The common format for submission by the Member States of the information required under Article 22(1) of Regulation (EU) No 649/2012 is set out in the Annex to this Decision. The first report on information to be submitted by the Member States pursuant to Article 22(1) of Regulation (EU) No 649/2012 shall cover the calendar years 2014, 2015 and 2016. The following reports shall cover subsequent three-year periods.

column.name: NEXT_REPORTING
column.value: Reporting is every 3 years. No start date given in the Regulation.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Member States and the European Chemicals Agency shall forward information to the Commission every three years concerning the operation of the procedures provided for in this Regulation, including customs controls, infringements, penalties and remedial action, as appropriate. The Commission shall adopt an implementing act laying down in advance a common format for reporting.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: UNECE Air Emission Reporting

column.name: PARAMETERS
column.value: The annual Informative Inventory Report (IIR) on national emissions of SO2, NOX, NMVOC, CO, NH3 and various heavy metals and POP is prepared using the Guidelines for Estimating and Reporting Emission Data under the CLRTAP. The preparation of a structured Informative Inventory Report (IIR) contribute to the transparency of the information and facilitate national and international reviews.

column.name: AUTHORITY
column.value: Article 9f

column.name: TITLE
column.value: Report on the results of the official controls, and other enforcement measures taken

column.name: DATE_COMMENTS
column.value: The first report was due by 20 January 2012.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: Member States shall submit a report to the Agency every five years by 1 July on the results of the official controls, and other enforcement measures taken. The first report shall be submitted by 20 January 2012. The Agency shall make those reports available to the Commission, which shall take them into account for its report under Article 117 of Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006.

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: ECE/EB.AIR/122/Add.1, decisions 2013/3 and 2013/4

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value: Every four years from 2017 onward, Parties shall report for the year x-2 updated aggregated sectoral (GNFR) gridded emissions and LPS emissions.

column.name: COMMENT
column.value: Emission data calculated by Parties within the geographic scope of EMEP shall be spatially allocated in the EMEP grid as defined in paragraph 14 of these Guidelines.

column.name: LOCATION_INFO
column.value: Reportnet Central Data Repository

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.value: European Union (EU) emission inventory report to the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE) Convention on Long-range Transboundary Air Pollution (CLRTAP).

column.name: PARAMETERS
column.value: Spatially allocated emissions (gridded data) may be calculated using national data sets appropriate to each Gridding NFR (GNFR) source category (as defined in annex V) in accordance with the EMEP/EEA Guidebook. As an alternative, a Party may calculate gridded emissions in a grid of approximately 50 x 50 square kilometres (km2) until it is technically and economically feasible to switch to a grid of 0.1 x 0.1 degrees.

column.name: TITLE
column.value: National Emission Ceiling Directive (NECD) - National emission inventories

column.name: FORMAT_NAME
column.value: ECE/EB.AIR/122/Add.1, decisions 2013/3 and 2013/4

column.name: REPORTING_FORMAT
column.value:
Natural emissions shall be reported in accordance with the methodologies on the LRTAP Convention and EMEP/EEA air pollutant emissions inventory guidebook. They shall not be included in national totals and shall be reported separately.
Re-submissions due to errors shall be provided within four weeks and include a clear explanation of the change made.

column.value:
EC Water Reporting Obligation
Member States shall, within three years of the publication of each Water Framework Directive River Basin Management Plan or its update, submit an interim report describing progress in the implementation of the planned programme of measures.
